usefulItems: baking tray (30 x 40 cm), baking paper, wire rack, oven
title: Apricot macadamia biscuits

ingredients.content: 30 g desiccated coconut, plus extra for sprinkling (optional)
150 g macadamia nuts, plus extra cut into halves, for garnishing

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 150°C. Line a large baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place all ingredients into mixing bowl and blend <b>2 min/speed 9<b> or until finely chopped and mixture is smooth and well combined.

Roll 2 teaspoons of mixture into a ball, place onto prepared baking tray and flatten slightly with your hands or a fork. Top with half a macadamia nut or sprinkle with extra coconut (optional). Repeat with remaining mixture (makes approx. 30 biscuits).

Bake for 10-15 minutes (150°C), or until lightly coloured (they will still be soft). Allow to cool on tray for 5-10 minutes to firm slightly. Transfer onto wire rack to cool completely before serving.

hintsAndTricks: It is important to use fresh dates in this recipe. Dried dates will make the mixture too crumbly.
Try to source preservative-free desiccated coconut and dried apricots.
If you prefer, you can use mixed spice instead of cinnamon.

<b>Bliss balls:<b> You can make an unbaked bliss ball with this mixture. After combining the ingredients, roll the uncooked mixture into balls and coat in extra desiccated coconut. Place into a sealable container and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
